div.p: NARRATOR: Click on the high-risk choices option to see what happens when all three of them make high-risk choices over time.
NARRATOR: Person 3 crossed their trigger level and now has heart disease. Because their trigger level is the lowest, this person is likely to develop heart disease more quickly than the others.
NARRATOR: They may not have even realized it was happening until it was too late to prevent it. What happens if Person 1 and Person 2 keep making high-risk choices?

NARRATOR: Click the high-risk choices option and see. Now Person 2 has heart disease, as well. Keep in mind that it is possible for Person 1 to develop heart disease as well if he or she continues to make high-risk choices.
